entry.title: Digital Art Installation on Bahnhofstrasse
entry.content:
Bahnhofstrasse 66 was from 1927 to 2012 the flagship store of BALLY. The house was designed by the Zurich Architects Häfeli, Moser, Steiger and the eye-catcher of the building were 5 balls attached to side of it with the logo of Bally. When "Zara" moved their store into the building, the city of Zurich decided that the building (including the 5 balls) which is protected by Swiss Heritage  Society should still be adorned by the 5  BALLY balls.
For obvious reasons Zara was not  keen of having a name of a different brand on building of their Zurich flagship store. A solution was found: the 5 original Bally balls are stored and have been replaced by 5 balls that display by led lights a variation of 564 words, such as urban, story, theme etc. The words are not allowed to display any advertisement, brands, political propaganda and were created by the Zurich company WBG.

entry.title: Visit Zürich's sweet spots that aren’t in the guidebooks
entry.content: An original fun and delicious way to visit our city, and learn that it’s not all about milk chocolate in the Alps. Kerrin of MyKugelhopf, true connoisseur of desserts, confections and chocolate, will let her sweet tooth guide you around the charming old town to discover some of the city’s most irresistible sweets . Sweet Zürich” tours are Tuesday to Friday afternoons at 2pm. Tours stay small (2-8 people), last about 2.5 hours and cost CHF 85 per person. All you need are comfortable shoes and a love of sweets!  http://mykugelhopf.ch/sweet-zurich-tour/

entry.title: Zurich's most famous sausage stand
entry.content: The Sternen Grill at Bellevue is fast food Zurich style, where you will get a grilled  Bratwurst, Cervelat, crusty bread rolls (Bürli), homemade spicy mustard and their famous Sternen Bier. It is not fancy, no place to sit down, the people behind the grill are not very friendly but it is still the place to be and you should definitely try one of their sausages. www.sternengrill.ch/

entry.title: Japanese Inspirations at the Kunsthaus - well curated exhibition
entry.content: The Museum Kunsthaus shows until May 10, 2015 a special exhibition featuring such well known painters as Monet, Gauguin, Van Gogh. Never before had the art, fashion and design of two cultural spheres come in as close contact as during the brief heyday of Japonsime. This phenomenon came about in the nineteenth century when Japan opened up to the world again after a period of almost complete isolation lasting more than two hundred years, triggering a lively exchange of ideas and goods. www.kunsthaus.ch

entry.title: Go to a movie theater in Zurich
entry.content:
I always like the experience of going to a movie theater in a foreign city. Almost all films in Zurich are shown in their original language (mostly English) with German subtitles. There are about 20 movie theaters in Zurich, but the three following ones are my favourites:

  • Kino Uto (one of the oldest ones),
  • Kino Riffraff (shows great studio films)
  • Kino Houdini (the newest movie theater )

entry.title: Restaurant George - high above the Casino and Zurich's rooftops
entry.content:
Welcome to the living room of the fictional host GEORGE. On their website George welcome you to his living room which can be described as: elegant, cultivated and distinguished. The restaurant is dominated by a lively bar in the center, live piano music and comfortable seating arrangements where you can enjoy good steaks, surf and turf as well as a variation of salads to start off your meal. The steaks are grilled to perfection, served with a sauce of your choice,  all the side dishes cost extra which makes the dining experience rather expensive.
http://george-grill.ch/
